PASADENA YACHT & COUNTRY CLUB WEDDINGS & EVENTS
waterfront ceremonies and receptions
Call 727-381-7922 X17
The Club is available on a limited basis for weddings, special parties, organization galas and fundraisers.  Let the professional staff at Pasadena Yacht & Country Club help you make your organization's next event something special.  PYCC's facilities are available for a limited number of events hosted by both Members and non-Members.
Thank you for visiting our website.  Please complete the short form below.  We will respond to you promptly to discuss your upcoming wedding or special event.

Directions
Pasadena Yacht and Country Club is located in southwest St. Petersburg, on the south side of Gulfport Blvd., between 58th St. South and 64th St. South.
​
TO GET HERE BY LAND
FROM TAMPA & CLEARWATER
Take I-275 South to Exit 19 (22nd Ave. South) old exit 6. Turn right off the exit. (22nd Ave. South becomes Gulfport Blvd.) Continue straight for approximately 2 ½ miles. Pasadena Yacht & Country Club gatehouse is located on the left (south side of Gulfport Blvd).
FROM BRADENTON & AREAS SOUTH
Take I-275 North to Exit 17 old exit 5, turn left off the exit. Continue to light at 34th St. (also known as US 19) and turn right. Go to the next light, which is 22nd Ave. South and turn left. (22nd Ave. South becomes Gulfport Blvd.) Continue straight for about 2 ½ miles. Pasadena Yacht & Country Club is on the left.
​
FROM THE BEACHES
Take Gulf Blvd. (go south if you are located 76th Ave. or higher, north if you are 74th Ave. or lower) to 75th Ave. Take 75th Ave. east. Cross Corey Causeway, at which point 75th Ave. turns into Pasadena Ave. After ¼ mile, turn right onto Gulfport Blvd. Follow Gulfport Blvd. for approximately ¾ mile, and the entrance to the Pasadena Community will be on the right. The Club is straight ahead ¼ on the left hand side after accessing the community.
BY SEA
FROM THE NORTH ON INTRACOASTAL
:  Turn to port (left) after passing between Green #31 and Red #32 markers.  Red #16 will be ahead and should be passed on the port (left) side of the boat.  Look ahead for PYCC Green #1 which will also be passed on the port (left) side of the boat.  Follow the channel to Red #12 and turn off to starboard (right) and make another starboard turn and then a port turn into the marina basin.
FROM THE SOUTH
:  Pass under the Pinellas Bayway fixed structure "C" bridge (clearance 65') heading North on the Intracoastal Waterway.
Pass Red #30 marker and turn off to starboard (right) and keep Green #17 marker on the starboard side of the boat.  Red # 16 marker will be ahead and should be passed on the port (left) side of the boat.  Look ahead for PYCC Green#1 marker which will also be passed on the port side of the boat.  Follow the channel to Red #12 marker and turn off to starboard (right).  Turn again to starboard then to port into the marina basin.
Follow us on Facebook and Instagram!

member central
REALTOR INFO
​Membership Opportunities
Full Golf
Available to those forty (40) years of age and above.  This membership provides access to all of the Club's facilities including: golf, complimentary annual range play, tennis, swimming, fitness facilities, dining, reciprocal privileges and all social related activities, as well as rental of available boat slips.
Privileges shall extend to the Member, Members spouse and dependent children under the age of twenty-seven (27) who are living at home or attending an accredited university on a full-time basis.
Executive I Golf
Available to those who are between the ages of thirty-one (31) and thirty-nine (39), inclusive.  This membership provides access to all of the Club's facilities including: golf, complimentary annual range play, tennis, swimming, fitness facilities, dining, reciprocal privileges and all social related activities, as well as rental of available boat slips.
Executive II Golf
Available to those who are between the ages of twenty-one (21) and thirty (30).  This membership provides access to all of the Club's facilities including: golf, complimentary annual range play, tennis, swimming, fitness facilities, dining, reciprocal privileges and all social related activities, as well as rental of available boat slips.
Golf Family
extends golf privileges to three or more golfers per family.
​​Golf
Couple
extends golf privileges to two golfers per family.
Golf Individual
extends golf privileges to one golfer per family.  Non-golf members of the family will have access and privileges to all club facilities (with the exception of golf privileges).
​
​Sport
Family membership - provides access to Club facilities including: tennis, swimming, fitness, dining, reciprocal yachting privileges and all social related activities, as well as ability to lease available boat slips.  Sport Members may play golf two times per month paying prevailing cart and green fees. Does not include range privileges.  Membership use may
include the Member, Members spouse and dependent children under the age of twenty-seven (27) who are living at home or attending an accredited university on a full-time basis.
​
​
All Membership types are required to spend a minimum of $700 in food and beverage  annually.
Private tours by appointment.   Please contact Sarah Harvey in the
Membership office
to schedule your club tour - 727-381-7922
Ex. 11

Michael Fream,
PGA
​Head Golf Professional
Michael was born in Baltimore, Maryland, but spent most of his childhood in Lakeland, Florida. He began to play golf during his high school years and quickly fell in love with the game. He earned his bachelor’s degree in Professional Golf Management from Florida State University. During his time at FSU, Michael was a member of the Marching Chiefs Big 8 Drum line. Michael was elected to PGA membership in 2016 and has worked at various high-end facilities during his professional career so far. He is passionate about expanding the game of golf and excited about the opportunity to do that at PYCC.
Fielding Brewbaker
Director of Instruction, PGA Associate - TPI Certified Level II golf
​
Fielding Brewbaker was born and raised in Salem, VA.  He and his wife moved to Largo in September of 2014 and fell in love with the area.  He played college golf at James Madison University and graduated in 2009 with a Sports Management degree and a minor in Business.  Fielding turned professional after the US Amateur in 2009 and played full time until November 2015 when he started working at The Concession Golf Club in Bradenton, FL.
He has played events on the PGA Tour and was on the Web.com Tour.  He travelled extensively and competed on various mini tours throughout the East Coast and Africa.  He said "I am very excited and thankful about the opportunity to be here at Pasadena Yacht & Country Club where I can continue my PGA program work and help some great people with their games as well!"
My plan for every student is to work with them to figure out what their goals are and then maximize their potential of reaching those goals.  Every swing has an individual 'signature', my goal is to make each student better at using it.​
​Ginger Nazarre,
LPGA
Assistant Golf Professional
​
Born in the Ocean state of Rhode Island, Ginger moved to Florida in 2006.  She pursued her dream to join the LPGA and married the love of her life.
Ginger was offered a position on the golf team at Pasadena Yacht & Country Club in 2007 where she continues to share her education with Members and Students.
​
Gingers motto "Never stop chasing your dreams".​
Golf Shop Staff
Jim Gerber
​Robert Vinson

A private club rich in history and tradition...
The Pasadena Yacht & Country Club is situated in southern Pinellas County, centrally located minutes from Downtown St. Petersburg, Treasure Island and St. Pete Beach. The clubhouse and grounds offer a peaceful, open atmosphere amid nearly 300 acres of subtropical landscaping, which is home to abundant wildlife.  Pasadena residents enjoy a strong sense of community in an exclusive, luxurious environment. Boca Ciega Bay offers refreshing breezes and a picturesque horizon.
Pasadena Yacht and Country Club is a private Member club with long history and first-class amenities. Our long standing tradition includes hosting a number of PGA and LPGA events. The club and course has been host to the likes of Arnold Palmer, Walter Hagen, Babe Ruth, Michael Jordan, and legendary LPGA founder Babe Dedrikson Zaharias.  In fact, Walter Hagen served as our first club professional during the early years of the club. This 18-hole Championship golf course was originally designed in the 1920's and was renovated in the 1980's by legendary golfer Arnold Palmer.  Pasadena Yacht & Country Club is considered one of the top courses in this area.
Since purchasing the club in 2016, the current ownership has embarked on an extensive and on-going renovation throughout the property.  Members are excited with each new improvement.    Clubhouse - 727-381-7922
​

EVENTS
Events may only be attended by Members and their accompanied guests.
Members may RSVP to any event by filling out the form below.  Our concierge will reply within 48 hours to confirm your reservation.

At PYCC, we will do our best to meet all special requests, however, there are times when we cannot.  We appreciate your patience and understanding in these instances.  ​
